docs.title: Abuse/Neglect/Mistreatment Prevention, Reporting, and Investigation Policy
docs.heading: Immediate Safety
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Administration → Abuse Reporting
docs.text: Ensure resident safety first; separate parties if needed and notify leadership per policy.

docs.title: Abuse/Neglect/Mistreatment Prevention, Reporting, and Investigation Policy
docs.heading: Objective Documentation
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Administration → Abuse Reporting
docs.text: Document objective findings and resident statement when possible; avoid assumptions or conclusions.

docs.title: Abuse/Neglect/Mistreatment Prevention, Reporting, and Investigation Policy
docs.heading: Notifications
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Administration → Abuse Reporting
docs.text: Notify Administrator/DON and follow the facility reporting workflow; document time, person notified, and outcome.

docs.title: Abuse/Neglect/Mistreatment Prevention, Reporting, and Investigation Policy
docs.heading: Injury Assessment
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Administration → Abuse Reporting
docs.text: Assess and document injuries with location, size, color, and photographs per policy if applicable.

docs.title: Abuse/Neglect/Mistreatment Prevention, Reporting, and Investigation Policy
docs.heading: Preservation of Evidence
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Administration → Abuse Reporting
docs.text: Preserve relevant evidence and maintain chain of custody steps per policy when indicated.

docs.title: Abuse/Neglect/Mistreatment Prevention, Reporting, and Investigation Policy
docs.heading: Family/Emergency Contact
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Administration → Abuse Reporting
docs.text: Notify family/emergency contact per policy unless restricted by investigation guidance; document notification.

docs.title: Falls, Injury Response, and Post-Fall Monitoring Policy
docs.heading: Post-Fall Assessment
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Safety → Falls
docs.text: Complete immediate assessment including vital signs, pain, neuro status, and visible injuries; compare to baseline.

docs.title: Falls, Injury Response, and Post-Fall Monitoring Policy
docs.heading: Head Strike & Anticoagulants
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Safety → Falls
docs.text: If head strike suspected or resident is on anticoagulant/antiplatelet therapy, escalate per protocol and increase monitoring.

docs.title: Falls, Injury Response, and Post-Fall Monitoring Policy
docs.heading: Neuro Checks
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Safety → Falls
docs.text: Initiate neuro checks per protocol/orders when indicated; document frequency, findings, and escalation criteria.

docs.title: Falls, Injury Response, and Post-Fall Monitoring Policy
docs.heading: Provider Notification
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Safety → Falls
docs.text: Notify provider using SBAR; document orders received and actions taken.

docs.title: Falls, Injury Response, and Post-Fall Monitoring Policy
docs.heading: Family Notification
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Safety → Falls
docs.text: Notify family/emergency contact per policy and document contact and response.

docs.title: Change in Condition Assessment & Provider Notification Policy
docs.heading: Recognize Change
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Nursing Policies → Change in Condition
docs.text: Identify acute change from baseline (mental status, respiratory status, pain, intake, mobility) and initiate focused assessment.

docs.title: Change in Condition Assessment & Provider Notification Policy
docs.heading: SBAR Communication
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Nursing Policies → Change in Condition
docs.text: Use SBAR format for provider notification; include baseline, current findings, and your recommendation/request.

docs.title: Change in Condition Assessment & Provider Notification Policy
docs.heading: Monitoring
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Nursing Policies → Change in Condition
docs.text: Increase monitoring based on severity and provider orders; define what changes require escalation.

docs.title: Change in Condition Assessment & Provider Notification Policy
docs.heading: Documentation
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Nursing Policies → Change in Condition
docs.text: Document time course, objective findings, interventions, response, notifications, and plan.

docs.title: Infection Prevention & Isolation Precautions Policy
docs.heading: Standard Precautions
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Infection Prevention → Precautions
docs.text: Apply Standard Precautions for all residents; perform hand hygiene and use PPE based on anticipated exposure.

docs.title: Infection Prevention & Isolation Precautions Policy
docs.heading: Transmission-Based Precautions
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Infection Prevention → Precautions
docs.text: Initiate Contact/Droplet/Airborne precautions when indicated; post signage and use dedicated equipment as required.

docs.title: Infection Prevention & Isolation Precautions Policy
docs.heading: Outbreak Response
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Infection Prevention → Precautions
docs.text: For suspected outbreak, initiate case tracking/line listing and notify Infection Prevention leadership per policy.

docs.title: Infection Prevention & Isolation Precautions Policy
docs.heading: Reporting
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Infection Prevention → Precautions
docs.text: Follow reporting requirements for communicable diseases/outbreaks and document actions taken.

docs.title: Skin Integrity & Pressure Injury Prevention/Treatment Policy
docs.heading: Skin Assessment
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Wound Care → Skin Integrity
docs.text: Assess skin routinely and with any change in condition; document location, staging/description, drainage, odor, and surrounding tissue.

docs.title: Skin Integrity & Pressure Injury Prevention/Treatment Policy
docs.heading: Prevention
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Wound Care → Skin Integrity
docs.text: Implement prevention: turning/repositioning, offloading, moisture management, nutrition/hydration support.

docs.title: Skin Integrity & Pressure Injury Prevention/Treatment Policy
docs.heading: Treatment
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Wound Care → Skin Integrity
docs.text: Provide wound care per orders/protocol; document dressing type, wound response, and tolerance.

docs.title: Skin Integrity & Pressure Injury Prevention/Treatment Policy
docs.heading: Escalation
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Wound Care → Skin Integrity
docs.text: Escalate for signs of infection or rapid deterioration; notify provider and wound team per policy.

docs.title: Medication Error & Adverse Drug Reaction Response Policy
docs.heading: Immediate Response
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Pharmacy → Medication Safety
docs.text: If medication error or suspected adverse drug reaction occurs, assess resident, ensure safety, and notify provider per protocol.

docs.title: Medication Error & Adverse Drug Reaction Response Policy
docs.heading: Monitoring
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Pharmacy → Medication Safety
docs.text: Increase monitoring for expected adverse effects; document symptoms, vitals, and response.

docs.title: Medication Error & Adverse Drug Reaction Response Policy
docs.heading: Documentation
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Pharmacy → Medication Safety
docs.text: Complete required incident documentation and medication record updates per policy.

docs.title: Medication Error & Adverse Drug Reaction Response Policy
docs.heading: Family Notification
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Pharmacy → Medication Safety
docs.text: Notify family/emergency contact as required; document time and response.

docs.title: CDC: Core Infection Prevention Practices
docs.heading: Hand Hygiene
docs.url_or_location: CDC (online) - Core Practices
docs.text: Perform hand hygiene at key moments (before/after resident contact, after glove removal, after contact with bodily fluids).

docs.title: CDC: Core Infection Prevention Practices
docs.heading: PPE Selection
docs.url_or_location: CDC (online) - Core Practices
docs.text: Select PPE based on anticipated exposure: gloves, gown, mask/eye protection when splash/spray is possible.

docs.title: CDC: Core Infection Prevention Practices
docs.heading: Respiratory Hygiene
docs.url_or_location: CDC (online) - Core Practices
docs.text: Implement respiratory hygiene/cough etiquette and source control when respiratory symptoms are present.

docs.title: CDC: Transmission-Based Precautions Overview
docs.heading: Contact Precautions
docs.url_or_location: CDC (online) - Transmission-Based Precautions
docs.text: Use Contact Precautions for pathogens spread by direct/indirect contact; dedicate equipment and clean high-touch surfaces.

docs.title: CDC: Transmission-Based Precautions Overview
docs.heading: Droplet Precautions
docs.url_or_location: CDC (online) - Transmission-Based Precautions
docs.text: Use Droplet Precautions for pathogens spread by respiratory droplets; use mask and eye protection per guidance.

docs.title: CDC: Transmission-Based Precautions Overview
docs.heading: Airborne Precautions
docs.url_or_location: CDC (online) - Transmission-Based Precautions
docs.text: Use Airborne Precautions for airborne pathogens; use respirator and appropriate room controls as applicable.

docs.title: CMS: 42 CFR Part 483 (Nursing Home Requirements)
docs.heading: Documentation Requirements (General)
docs.url_or_location: eCFR (online) - 42 CFR Part 483
docs.text: Maintain complete, accurate documentation supporting assessment, care planning, interventions, and outcomes.

docs.title: CMS: State Operations Manual Appendix PP (Surveyor Guidance)
docs.heading: Survey Readiness (General)
docs.url_or_location: CMS (online) - Appendix PP
docs.text: Be able to demonstrate policies are implemented consistently with documentation showing assessment, interventions, monitoring, and follow-up.

docs.title: NYSDOH: Infection Prevention Guidance for LTC
docs.heading: Reporting & Outbreak Coordination (General)
docs.url_or_location: NYSDOH (online) - LTC Infection Prevention
docs.text: Follow state reporting requirements and coordinate outbreak response, tracking, and communication per guidance.

docs.title: NYSDOH: Reporting Requirements (General Reference)
docs.heading: Reporting Pathways (General)
docs.url_or_location: NYSDOH (online) - Reporting
docs.text: Follow required reporting pathways for incidents, allegations, and communicable diseases; document time and recipients.

docs.title: Change in Condition Assessment & Provider Notification Policy
docs.heading: Fever / suspected infection — Key Assessment 1
docs.url_or_location: Binder: Nursing Policies → Change in Condition
docs.text: Monitor temperature trends and associated symptoms; assess hydration and mental status changes.
